title.native: あやかしトライアングル

description:
Japan may be brimming with mysterious monsters called ayakashi, but they have a special exorcist ninja force to counter the threat! Young exorcist ninja Matsuri spends his days fighting ayakashi to protect his childhood friend Suzu. But when an ayakashi cat named Shirogane shows up, things get turned upside down!

(Source: MANGA Plus)
synonyms: เรื่องอลวนคนปิศาจ

tags.name: Ninja
tags.description: Prominently features Japanese warriors traditionally trained in espionage, sabotage and assasination.

tags.name: Youkai
tags.description: Prominently features supernatural creatures from Japanese folklore.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: Exorcism
tags.description: Involving religious methods of vanquishing youkai, demons, or other supernatural entities.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Bisexual
tags.description: Features a character who is romantically or sexually attracted to people of more than one sex or gender.

title.native: あやかしトライアングル

name.native: ルン・エルシ・ジュエリア

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yabuki_info)

A Japanese manga artist. His mentor was Takeshi Obata, the illustrator of Death Note, Hikaru no Go, Bakuman and Platinum End. The mangaka [Shinohara Kenta](https://anilist.co/staff/97994/Shinohara-Kenta) is his brother-in-law.

Yabuki is best known for his series Black Cat, which ran from 2000 to 2004 in Weekly Shounen Jump and later adapted into an anime. Upon its ending, Yabuki expressed desire to make a sequel from the series, or make its characters reappear in another work. From 2004 to 2020, he only worked as illustrator to works written by other authors, most notably on To Love-Ru alongside his former assistant Saki Hasemi. That was until the release of Ayakashi Triangle on the pages of Shounen Jump in 2020.
Started off as a composite artist.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/735599437054017536)

Worked as a production manager and composite artist in the beginning of his career.

__[Website](http://shogo.strikes.jp/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/shogoy)__

__Shougo Yasukawa__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter, series composer and lyricist.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/_silmeria_) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/_silmeria_/) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/54631733)
Hideki Furukawa is an animator and animation director.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

name.native: フィロソフィーのダンス

node.description:
[Offical Website](http://danceforphilosophy.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/dfp_2015)

Philosophy no Dance is a Japanese idol group.

[Website](http://kodama-ameko.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kodamameko)

Ameko Kodama is a Japanese lyricist.
Soulife is a a music unit consisting of [Souichirou Kawata](https://anilist.co/staff/266865/SoichiroK) and [Nozomu Sasaki](https://anilist.co/staff/266862/NozomuS).

[Profile](http://artist.amuse.co.jp/artist/tomita_miyu/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/miyu-tomita/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/miyju_tomita) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tomita__miyu._/)

The Grand Prix winner of the 2014 Seiyuu Artist Training Program Selection competition, which was sponsored by Amuse and Ken Production. After being scouted by six talent agencies, she eventually joined Amuse.

She made her voice acting debut in 2015, voicing a number of unnamed characters in Himouto Umaru-chan.

Non-Anime Roles
• Layla - Genshin Impact (VG)
• Zara - Memento Mori (VG)
• New Jersey - Azur Lane (VG)
• Jiu Niangzi - Reverse: 1999 (VG)

__Height:__ 148 cm
__Hobbies:__ Traveling alone, sky watching, watching movies
__Skills & Abilities:__ Basketball

[Profile (Sigma 7)](https://sigma7.co.jp/actors/ichinose_kana) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ichinose_1220) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ichinose_kana1220/)

Won the 18th Annual Seiyū award as Best Lead Actor.

**Non-anime roles:**
• Mimi - Memento Mori (VG)
• Layla - THE iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls (VG)
• Hisui - Tsukihime -A piece of blue glass moon- (VN)

__[Website](http://shogo.strikes.jp/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/shogoy)__

__Shougo Yasukawa__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter, series composer and lyricist.
